description: Single storey side/rear (wrap around) extension (following demolition of existing side/rear addition); rear dormer roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope; Installation of one roof light to front roof slope; insertion of door at ground floor level and alteration of side fenestration
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 00P005 Rev B (Proposed Block Plan); 00P110 Rev E (Proposed Plans and Elevations); 00P010 Rev A (Existing Plans and Elevations); 00P002 Rev A (Location Plan); 00P210 (Existing and Proposed Boundary Wall Elevations); Design and Access Statement prepared by Diz Architects,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2). The materials used for the side wall of the proposed extension shall match those of the existing boundary wall. The proposed timber frames shall be white in colour.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3, D4, and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
